org.dejava.component.util.i18n.message.handler.impl

Class DefaultI18nMessageHandler

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.dejava.component.util.i18n.message.handler.impl.DefaultI18nMessageHandler
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    MessageHandler

    public class DefaultI18nMessageHandler
extends java.lang.Object
implements MessageHandler
    Default i18n message handler. Handles getting messages from within a class using the information provided by the annotations MessageBundles and MessageBundle. Uses the default Java i18n API. It works by searching the localized message bundle information at runtime (via annotations). It looks the classes at the current stack trace and tries to retrieve the annotations from these classes. The default depth of the search is 5. You can change this behavior by setting a new maximum search depth ( setMaxSearchDepth(java.lang.Integer)). If the localized message (with this internationalization handler) cannot be found with the information of the first class in the stack, it keeps looking in the next classes until the localized message is found or the maximum search depth is reached. Enjoy Java i18n and l10n!

      • getMessage

        public java.lang.String getMessage(java.util.Locale locale,
                          java.lang.String type,
                          java.lang.String key,
                          java.lang.Object[] parametersValues)
                            throws MessageNotFoundException,
                                   org.dejava.component.util.exception.localized.unchecked.EmptyParameterException
        Gets a localized message with the given key and parameters values of the defined type.
        Parameters:
        locale - Locale for the message.
        type - Type of the message. If no type is given, a default type will be used.
        key - Key for the localized message in the bundle.
        parametersValues - Parameter values for the message.
        Returns:
        A localized message with the given key and parameters values of the defined type.
        Throws:
        MessageNotFoundException - If the localized message cannot be found.
        org.dejava.component.util.exception.localized.unchecked.EmptyParameterException - If the key for the localized message is empty.
